Composing an Email

  1. Click the “Compose” button at the top of the left sidebar. A new message window will appear in the bottom right corner of the web page.

    The new message window has three sections, from top to bottom, these are:
    1. The Recipients Section
    2. The Subject Section
    3. The Message Body Section

  2. Click the recipients section. Enter the email address(es) of the intended message recipients. To send mail to multiple recipients, press enter after entering each email address.

    The recipients section has two other options, Cc (Carbon Copy) and Bcc (Blind Carbon Copy). These buttons appear on the right side of the recipients section when the recipients section is selected. Clicking on either one will create a new line for Cc or Bcc email addresses, depending on the button the user clicked.
    • Cc'ing an email address in an email will send a copy of that email to the email address Cc'ed. This Cc'ed email address will be visible to the primary recipient(s) of the email.
    • Bcc'ing an email address in an email will send a copy of that email to the email address Bcc'ed. This Bcc'ed email address will *not* be visible to the primary recipient(s) of the email.
  3. Click the subject section. Type the subject of the email.

  4. Click on the message body section. Type the message body.

    The user has several options to format, the message body on the toolbar at the bottom of the new message window by clicking on the buttons on this toolbar. These options include (from left to right):

    • Formatting options for the text, including font size, text color, indentation options, and text alignment options
    • Attaching files to the Email
    • Adding hyperlinks in the message text
    • Inserting emojis
    • Inserting files from google drive
    • Inserting images into the email, which can be:
      • Uploaded from the user's computer
      • Inserted as a link from the internet
      • Chosen from the user's Google Drive or Google Photos account
    • Toggling confidential mode, which:
      • Keeps the recipient of the email from copying, printing, forwarding, or downloading the email
      • Allows the user to set an expiration date, after which the email will no longer be able to be viewed
      • Allows the user to set a requirement that the recipient of the email authenticate themselves via SMS before viewing the email
    • Insert a signature, which can be defined by the user in Gmail settings
    • A more button, which displays further options including:
      • Making the message window fullscreen
      • Add a label to the current email
      • View the email as plain text
      • Print the email
      • Check the spelling of the email
      • Give feedback for Gmail's Smart Compose feature (which is beyond the scope of this documentation)
    The user also has the option to delete the draft of this email. To do this, click the trash button on the bottom right of the new message window.

  5. After composing the email, click the blue send button on the bottom left of the new message window.

    On the right-hand side of this button is a small white arrow, which can be clicked to give you a button labeled "Schedule Send." To schedule that the email be sent at a specified later date and time:
    1. Click this "Schedule Send" button.
    2. A window will then appear in the middle of the web page.
    3. Pick the date and time that this email should be sent and click the blue "Schedule Send" button.
